reviewText: Time to learn Russian
voteText: 92 of 124 people (74%) found this review helpful 68 people found this review funny

reviewText:
This review will not be very in-depth since the majority of this game requires an understanding of Russian language.

I liked this game, beside the fact that I couldn’t read a thing about what I was doing, I enjoyed doing it. It’s a new kind of game that I haven’t experienced before.

Pros:
It’s free
It wouldn’t be complicated if it was in English
It’s an interesting concept
An English version is planned to come out
And combat doesn’t require you to read

Cons:
You won’t know what you’re doing through the tutorial since it’s in Russian.

There are 3 main game modes that I found; A 3v3 Deathmatch with and against players, a 1v1Deathmatch against another player, and a 3v5 with players against computers.


If you do end up playing this game, you should just stick to the combat until the English game comes out.

reviewText:
Would recommend, for a knock about in a free game. Not saying it'll be on my most played list but I'm not uninstalling it immediately either, it's quite good fun and decent eye candy

Even with no grasp of Russian you can muddle your way through to some pretty satisfying alien destruction, though the walls of cyrillic text from Cpt Picard's effeminate grandson can be a bit daunting. Mostly it works if you click the green buttons?

Couldn't find out how to quit though, 10/10 would alt-f4 every time

reviewText:
Please beware, I attempted to read the Russian but the tutorial went way too slow for the amount of text it had so I was attempting to skip it the entire time and didn't get to read everything.

I very much enjoyed this game with it's fun, smooth, simple gameplay and its futuristic, warship theme. It didn't really have any lore but that doesn't matter considering it's free. The game is so simple that you don't even need the ability to read in order to figure out what's going on so even if you were my neglected goldfish, you should still be able to play. I found this game intersting considering that it's about the most creative thing you will find in the last two-three years. If you take a look at the amount of re-used jokes in Family Guy or the shooter genre, you would probably agree.

Pros:
It's free
The tutorial shows gameplay while teaching you (which is cool I guess?)
It's simple
It's fun
It's exciting
It's like a MOBA but fun
It has few micro-transactions (I didn't really notice any but I'm pretty sure there are some)
It has better animations than the latest Scooby-Doo series.
The community isn't toxic (I suggest you become good before it does)
Cons:
THE TUTORIAL IS SO ♥♥♥♥ING LONG! THERE IS LIKE TWO PARAGRAPHS WORTH OF INFORMATION IN IT! (and no skip button :P)
They didn't explain when the English version is gonna release (not that I'm complaining but it is bad for others)
There is a framerate drop.
It has a tendency to go into a process of crashing.
The main menu may actually never load or show you how to begin to play as there are no buttons or loading signs...

If I were you I would begin to play now before everyone else begins too however I'm not you and actually have a life away from the computer screen (the one by the TV where that rusty playstationboy 64 is kept). If you can't speak Russian, I suggest you just watch the gameplay and flashing arrows pointing at cool looking things during the tutorial as you might or might not learn something. If you told me you had a life away from anything electronic related, I would think you were lying and then tell you to wait for the English version but who knows how long that'll take?

reviewText:
This game is as free as any mobile city building/quest game. Its a free to download game where you pay to speed up your progress which otherwise will take you weeks to months to be on par with other players who will already be in your games with better ships and equipment .

AstroLords is a game where you build your city and then go on different quests such as boss fights,pvp and defense agains aliens .You can play agaist AI but very often some veteral player will get into your game and woop your ♥♥♥ with bigger ship . Most games like this are Pay to Win and it does feel underwelming for new player when my ship has 100 defense and the other guy has 170 or more .

I think this game is trying to be like multiplayer Spacerangers which is not a bad thing .It is a really cool concept and game has a lot of depth behind it more so than boom beach and games of that type . I speak russian and game is still hard to learn . If you don't speak russian well I don't think you will get very far not undestanding any skills and perks .

I mean its a good game but I just not gona drop cash just because it takes 3 days to build some ♥♥♥♥ otherwise . If you like games where you are forced to take brakes sometimes because you run out of things to fight with then by all means you will love this game .

reviewText:
Not bad for a small time-killer game.
Pros:
-Straightforward tutorials
-Simple interface
-Fun arcade-ish combat system
-Not bad visuals

Cons:
-Play for free,pay to win.
-Some parts could use some explaining For instance, I didn't know how to cancel research projects, but I asked and the players answered immediately.



Don't bother if you don't speak russian though. Some reviews list this as a con. Wtf people, the game explicitly says it is in russian. Even steam gives you a warning when you download it. What did you expect?

reviewText:
If you're looking for a review you've come to the wrong place, if you're here to cook a pie then read on !
Napoleon from the final puff pastry
You will need:
Ready flaky pastry - 1.5 kg five eggs Flour - 150 g> Sugar - 400 grams Milk - 1200 ml Vanilla sugar - 1 n. Cognac - 1 tbsp. l. Shelled walnuts - glass sequence of preparation: dough defrost naturally at room temperature (defrost time indicated on the package). Cook the custard: grind the egg yolks with a mixer or a whisk to a conventional incandescent and vanilla sugar, flour and brandy to enter the mix. The mixture pour a trickle of milk, stir and cook, stirring constantly. Divide the dough into the desired number of pieces that will later Korzh. Roll out each piece on a board sprinkled with flour. Bake in the oven for about 10 minutes until golden color on a dry baking temperature of 200 degrees. Fluff the cooled cream cakes. If desired, each layer sprinkled with chopped nuts. On top of the cake lightly press smeared with cream and sprinkle all sides crumbs. Add layer cake in a cool place overnight.

reviewText:
[+]
Interesting combat system - kind of mix of space rangers and SPAZ.
Base building - not as complicated as in Beyond Sol but still interesting.
Technology research.
Different weapons with different mechanics depending on situation you are in.
Good visuals. [-]
A little bit boring soundtrack.
Because this game is real-time tactic game controls sometimes feel laggy like with a 1 second delay even in a fight with bots.
No option to increase the text size - it is really hard to read some messages and descriptions on a big screen.
Pay-to-Win. There are premium ships and accounts in this game - kind of obvious for Free-to-Play game...
In case you are interested in pvp - there aren't that much people playing at the moment.------
Conclusion
I recommend this game because it's really interesting and fun. You may want to play it without a donation and see how far can you go.
As for me - I would prefer to pay 3-5$ for this game instead of donating since in my opinion donations are only going to kill it eventually.
